approx_hash_array.h

1 #ifndef VOXBLOX_UTILS_APPROX_HASH_ARRAY_H_
2 #define VOXBLOX_UTILS_APPROX_HASH_ARRAY_H_
3 
4 #include <array>
5 #include <atomic>
6 #include <limits>
7 #include "voxblox/core/common.h"
8 
9 // These classes allocate a fixed size array and index it with a hash that is
10 // masked so that only its first N bits are non zero. This can be
11 // thought of as a fast rough approximation of a hash table.
12 // There are several advantages and some very significant disadvantages
13 // Advantages-
14 // - Simple and blazing fast lockless thread-safe approximate sets
15 // - Can be used to provide more fine grain locking of blocks for threading then
16 // simply locking the entire layer
17 // Disadvantages-
18 // - Highly inefficient use of memory (allocates 2^N elements)
19 // - Cannot discern between two different elements with the same hash
20 // - If the hash of two elements have the same first N elements of their hash,
21 // only one can be stored.
22 
23 namespace voxblox {
24 
25 // Basic container, give in an index and get the element that was stored there.
26 // There are 2^unmasked_bits elements in the container, which element is
27 // returned depends on your hashing function.
28 // Uses at least 2^unmasked_bits * sizeof(StoreElement) bytes of ram
29 template <size_t unmasked_bits, typename StoredElement, typename IndexType,
30  typename IndexTypeHasher>
31 class ApproxHashArray {
32  public:
33  EIGEN_MAKE_ALIGNED_OPERATOR_NEW
34 
35  StoredElement& get(const size_t& hash) {
36  return pseudo_map_[hash & bit_mask_];
37  }
38 
39  StoredElement& get(const IndexType& index, size_t* hash) {
40  DCHECK(hash);
41  *hash = hasher_(index);
42  return get(*hash);
43  }
44 
45  StoredElement& get(const IndexType& index) {
46  size_t hash = hasher_(index);
47  return get(hash);
48  }
49 
50  private:
51  static constexpr size_t pseudo_map_size_ = (1 << unmasked_bits);
52  static constexpr size_t bit_mask_ = (1 << unmasked_bits) - 1;
53 
54  std::array<StoredElement, pseudo_map_size_> pseudo_map_;
55  IndexTypeHasher hasher_;
56 };
57 
58 // Acts as a fast and thread safe set, with the serious limitation of both
59 // false-negatives and false positives being possible.
60 // A false positive occurs if two different elements have the same hash, and the
61 // other element was already added to the set.
62 // A false negative occurs if an element was removed to add another element with
63 // the same masked hash. The chance of this happening is inversely proportional
64 // to 2^unmasked_bits.
65 // Uses at least (2^unmasked_bits + full_reset_threshold) * sizeof(StoreElement)
66 // bytes of ram.
67 // Note that the reset function is not thread safe.
68 template <size_t unmasked_bits, size_t full_reset_threshold, typename IndexType,
69  typename IndexTypeHasher>
70 class ApproxHashSet {
71  public:
72  EIGEN_MAKE_ALIGNED_OPERATOR_NEW
73 
74  ApproxHashSet() : offset_(0), pseudo_set_(pseudo_set_size_) {
75  for (std::atomic<size_t>& value : pseudo_set_) {
76  value.store(0, std::memory_order_relaxed);
77  }
78 
79  // The array used for storing values is initialized with zeros. However, the
80  // zeroth bin can actually store the 0 hash. Because of this to prevent a
81  // false positive on looking up a 0 hash this bin needs to initially store a
82  // different value.
83  pseudo_set_[offset_].store(std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max());
84  }
85 
86  // Returns true if an element with the same hash is currently in the set,
87  // false otherwise.
88  // Note due to the masking of bits, many elements that were previously
89  // inserted into the ApproxHashSet have been overwritten by other values.
90  inline bool isHashCurrentlyPresent(const size_t& hash) {
91  const size_t array_index = (hash & bit_mask_) + offset_;
92 
93  return (pseudo_set_[array_index].load(std::memory_order_relaxed) == hash);
94  }
95 
96  inline bool isHashCurrentlyPresent(const IndexType& index, size_t* hash) {
97  DCHECK(hash);
98  *hash = hasher_(index);
99  return isHashCurrentlyPresent(*hash);
100  }
101 
102  inline bool isHashCurrentlyPresent(const IndexType& index) {
103  size_t hash = hasher_(index);
104  return isHashCurrentlyPresent(hash);
105  }
106 
107  // Returns true if it replaced the element in the masked_hash's with the hash
108  // of the given element.
109  // Returns false if this hash was already there and no replacement was needed.
110  // !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
111  // !! This is the most expensive function in all of voxblox. !!
112  // !! Profile and test after even the most superficial change. !!
113  // !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
114  inline bool replaceHash(const size_t& hash) {
115  const size_t array_index = (hash & bit_mask_) + offset_;
116 
117  if (pseudo_set_[array_index].load(std::memory_order_relaxed) == hash) {
118  return false;
119  } else {
120  pseudo_set_[array_index].store(hash, std::memory_order_relaxed);
121  return true;
122  }
123  }
124 
125  inline bool replaceHash(const IndexType& index, size_t* hash) {
126  DCHECK(hash);
127  *hash = hasher_(index);
128  return replaceHash(*hash);
129  }
130 
131  inline bool replaceHash(const IndexType& index) {
132  const size_t hash = hasher_(index);
133  return replaceHash(hash);
134  }
135 
136  // If unmasked_bits is large, the array takes a lot of memory, this makes
137  // clearing it slow.
138  // However offsetting which bin hashes are placed into has the same effect.
139  // Once we run out of room to offset by (determined by full_reset_threshold)
140  // we clear the memory).
141  // This function is not thread safe.
142  void resetApproxSet() {
143  if (++offset_ >= full_reset_threshold) {
144  for (std::atomic<size_t>& value : pseudo_set_) {
145  value.store(0, std::memory_order_relaxed);
146  }
147  offset_ = 0;
148 
149  // The array used for storing values is initialized with zeros. However,
150  // the zeroth bin can actually store the 0 hash. Because of this to
151  // prevent a false positive on looking up a 0 hash this bin needs to
152  // initially store a different value.
153  pseudo_set_[offset_].store(std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max());
154  }
155  }
156 
157  private:
158  static constexpr size_t pseudo_set_size_ =
159  (1 << unmasked_bits) + full_reset_threshold;
160  static constexpr size_t bit_mask_ = (1 << unmasked_bits) - 1;
161 
162  size_t offset_;
163  std::vector<std::atomic<size_t>> pseudo_set_;
164 
165  IndexTypeHasher hasher_;
166 };
167 } // namespace voxblox
168 
169 #endif // VOXBLOX_UTILS_APPROX_HASH_ARRAY_H_
